result.execSummary:
The defendant Nancy Ann Ezell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory DNA costs assessed. Court costs are waived

No controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment until retirement. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

the balance is stayed
Concurrent with: 14CF363 & 15CF969

ADDRESS INFO for Nancy Ann Ezell
Current: 2203 Elisha Ave, Apt. B, Zion, IL 60099 United States  (Effective: 06-17-2016)
Prior: Homeless, Racine, WI 53404 United States
Faxed to ZCI on 6/17

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant must attend 3 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 1-7-2015:  Defendant is allowed contact with her minor grandchildren.

**AMENDED 4-20-2015:  Defendant no longer has to attend self-help meetings.

**AMENDED 6-25-2015:  NO CONTACT WITH REBECCA TESCHLER.  MAY NOT LIVE WITH REBECCA TESCHLER.**

AMENDED 06-17-2016; DEFENDANT NO LONGER HAS TO REPORT FOR WEEKLY TESTING. DEFENDANT ONLY HAS TO REPORT TO ZCI AFTER COURT APPEARANCES.
